question: Trump wins a solid blue state?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Republican candidate for president wins the popular vote in any solid blue state(s) in the 2024 U.S. Presidential election. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Solid blue states include: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Hawaii, Illinois, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Vermont, Virginia, and Washington.

Solid blue states are defined using the Cook Political Report's ratings as of this market's inception. Further changes to cook political report's rankings will not be considered for this market.

Individual congressional district electors will not count towards the resolution of this market; only statewide popular vote results will be considered.

A candidate shall be considered to represent a party in the event that he or she is the nominee, or has a ballot-listed or otherwise identifiable party preference, of the party in question.
This market may resolve immediately if at least one of the listed states has been called for the Republican candidate for President by the Associated Press, Fox News, and NBC, or if all listed states have been called by the Associated Press, Fox News, and NBC.

The resolution source for this market is the Associated Press, Fox News, and NBC. If all three sources haven’t called the race in the listed states for the same candidate, this market will resolve based on the official certification.

question: No sweeps in 1st round of NBA Playoffs?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if there are no sweeps in the first round of the 2024 NBA Playoffs. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

A sweep is defined as one team winning all four games in a best-of-seven series against another team. 

The resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.

events.title: NBA Playoffs: How many 1st round sweeps?

question: Will Fantano rate new Tswift album above 5?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Anthony Fantano gives Taylor Swift's "The Tortured Poets Department" a numerical rating above 5. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market will resolve based on the first official rating by Anthony Fantano of "The Tortured Poets Department", specifically the numerical rating he posts under the YouTube video for this review. If Anthony Fantano does not review "The Tortured Poets Department" by May 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "No". 

The resolution source for this market will be information from Anthony Fantano (e.g. https://www.youtube.com/@fantano, https://www.theneedledrop.com/articles/category/Reviews), specifcally an episode of The Needle Drop that rates "The Tortured Poets Department".

events.title: Will Fantano rate new Tswift album above 5?

question: Will Manchester City win the FA Cup?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Manchester City wins the The Football Association Challenge Cup for 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market may immediately resolve to "No" if it becomes impossible for Manchester City to win based on the rules of the competition.

The primary resolution source for this market will be footage from the FA Cup and official information from The Football Association (e.g. https://www.thefa.com/competitions/thefacup), however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: FA Cup: Man City vs. Chelsea
description:
In the upcoming FA Cup soccer match scheduled for April 20, 2024:

If Manchester City advances from the semi-finals, this market will resolve to "Man City". If Chelsea advances from the semi-finals, this market will resolve to "Chelsea".

If the game is not completed by April 27, 2024, the market will resolve to 50-50.

events.title: FA Cup: Man City vs. Chelsea

question: Shafik out as Columbia President in April?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Minouche Shafik ceases to be President of Columbia University for any length of time from April 18, 2024 through April 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

An announcement of her resignation before this market's end date will immediately resolve this market to "Yes", regardless of when the announced resignation goes into effect.

This market's resolution source will be official statements from Columbia University or a consensus of credible reporting.

events.title: Shafik out as Columbia President in April?
